modules.description: Creates and manages periodic function calls with precise timing control. Operates on time intervals and triggers a function at regular intervals, handling pauses, skips, and resumptions. Used to schedule recurring tasks like heartbeat signals, polling, or timed updates.

Handles time calculations, timezone conversions, and daylight saving adjustments using date and time values. Operates on structured representations of dates, times, and time zones. Enables precise scheduling and time-based logic in applications requiring accurate calendar operations.

Provides asynchronous sleep and yield operations for managing task scheduling in concurrent workflows. Operates with Lwt.t promises and floating-point durations. Used to introduce controlled delays or relinquish control in event loops for I/O-bound tasks.

Manages scheduled function executions at defined intervals, supporting precise control over timing, pauses, and resumption. It handles time-based triggers and maintains state for ongoing operations. Key data types include interval configurations and event handlers, with operations for starting, stopping, and adjusting schedules. Examples include setting up a heartbeat signal every 500 milliseconds or polling a resource at fixed intervals.

Creates a virtualized version of an Lwt engine, enabling isolated execution contexts. Operates on Lwt_engine.t values to manage asynchronous operations independently. Used to set up sandboxed environments for testing or concurrent task management.
